lg.l: Right trusty and so forth we let you to Know,
We are very ill us'd by you Mortalls below,
For first, I have often by Chymists been told,
Tho' I know nothing on't, it is I that make Gold,
Which when you have gott, you so carefully hide it,
That since I was Born I hardly have spy'd it
Then it must be allow'd when ever I shine
I forward the Grass and ripen the Vine
To me the good fellows apply for Reliefe
Without whom they cou'd gett neither Claret nor Beefe
Yet their Wine and their Victualls those Curmudgeon Lubbards
Lock up from my Sight in Pantrys and Cup·boards
That I have an Ill Eye they wickedly think
And Taint all their Meat and Sower their Drink
But Thirdly and lastly it must be allow'd
I alone can Inspire the Poeticall Crowd
This is gratefully own'd by each Boy in yẹ Colledge
Whom if I inspire it's not to my Knowledge
This every Pretender in Rhyme will admitt
Without troubling his Head about Iudgment or Witt
These Gentlemen use me with Kindness and freedom
And as for their Works when I please I may read 'em
They lye open on purpose on Compters and Stalls
And the Titles I View when I shine on yẹ Walls
But a Comrade of yours that Traytor Delany
Whom I for your Sake have us'd better than any
And of my Meer Motion and special good Grace,
Intended in time to succeed in your place,
On Tuesday the ninth, seditiously came
With a certain false Traytress one Stella by Name
To the Deanry House, and on the north Glass
Where for fear of the Cold I never can pass
Then and there Vi et Armis with a certain Utensil
Of Value five shillings, in English a pencill
Did Malitiously falsely and Trayterously Write
While Stella aforesaid stood by with the light
My Sister has lately depos'd upon Oath
That she stop'd in her Course to look on them both
That Stella was helping abetting and aiding
And still as he writ stood smiling and reading
That her Eyes were as Bright as my self at noon Day
But her gracefull black Locks were mingled with Gray
And by the Description I certainly Know
'Tis the Nymph that I courted some ten Years ago
Whom when I with the best of my Tallents endued
On her promise of Yeilding she acted the Prude
That some Verses were writ with felonious Intent
Direct to the north where I never went
That the Letters appear'd revers'd on the Pane
But in Stellas Bright Eyes were plac'd right againe
Wherein she distinctly cou'd read every line
And presently guest the fancy was mine
She can swear to the Person whom oft she has seen
At night between Cavan Street and Colledge Green
Now you see why his Verses so seldom are shown
The Reason is plain they are none of his own
And observe while you live that no man is shy
To discover the goods he came honestly by.
If I light on a Thought he will certainly steal it
And when he has gott it finds ways to conceale it
Of all the fine things he keeps in the Dark
There's scarce one in Ten but what has my marke
And let them be seen by the World if he dare
Il'e make it appear they're all stolen Ware
But as for the Poem he writ on your Sash
I think I have now gott him under my lash
My Sister transcrib'd it last night to his sorrow
And the Publick shall see it if I live till to morrow
Thro' the Zodiack around it shall quickly be spread
In all part of ye Globe where your Language is read
He Knows very well I 'neer gave a refusal
When he ask'd for my Aid in forms that are usual
But the Secret is this I did lately intend
To write a few Verses on you as my Friend
I study'd a fortnight before I cou'd find
As I rode in my Chariot a thought to my Mind
And Resolv'd the next Winter for that is my time
When the days are at shortest to put it in Rhyme
Till then it was lock'd in my Box at Parnassus
When that subtle Compainon in hopes to surpass us
Conveys out my paper of hints by a trick
For I think in my Conscience he deals with old Nick
And from my own stock provided with Topicks
He getts to a Window beyond both the Tropicks
There out of my sight Just against the north zoan
Writes down my Conceits and calls them his own
And you like a Cully the Bubble can swallow
Now who but Delany can write like Apollo?
High Treason by Statute, but here you object
He only stole hints, but the verse is correct
Tho' the Thought be Appollo's it's finely expres't
So a Thiefe steals my Horse and getts him well drest
Now whereas the said Criminal seems past repentance
Wee Phœbus think fitt to proceed to his Sentence
Since Delany has dar'd like Prometheus his Sire
To Climb to our Region and thence to steal fire
We order a Vulture in shape of the spleen
To Prey on his Liver but not to be seen
And We order our subjects of every Degree
To Believe all his Verses were writen by me
And under the pain of our highest displeasure
To call nothing his but the Rhyme & the measure
And Lastly for Stella just out of her prime
I am too much reveng'd already by time
In return to her Scorn I sent her diseases
And will now be her Friend whenever she pleases
And the Gifts I bestow'd her will find her a Lover
Tho' she lives till she's Gray as a Badger──── all over
